snippet: Increasing time in school is one of the best ways to narrow the achievement gap between rich and poor students, education advocates say.
abstract: As many as 170 schools across the country have extended their calendars to 190 days or longer; trend reflects growing consensus that longer school years are one of the best ways to narrow the achievement gap between rich and poor students.
lead_paragraph: Increasing time in school is one of the best ways to narrow the achievement gap between rich and poor students, education advocates say.

headline.seo: Some Schools Adopting Longer Years to Improve Learning
headline.main: To Increase Learning Time, Some Schools Add Days to Academic Year
